intro: Anisoptera curtisii, commonly known as the desert willow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, willow-like leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and showy inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anisoptera curtisii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
